intro: Lobelia vagans, commonly known as the wandering lobe, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lobelia vagans is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
